Hey there :wave:
New minor release of boilerplate (v3.4: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/releases/tag/v3.4.0>)! There are a few minor feature enhancements and a few bug fixes related to theme settings/style fields that were addressed. Please check out the release notes for more details!

Hey Elise - just seeing this now (hoping you were able to find it :crossed_fingers:) but in case you're still troubleshooting it looks like the padding is set in theme settings here (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/css/theme-overrides.css#L127-L130>) which is pulled in from the variable set here (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/css/theme-overrides.css#L34>) with the `1rem` being what I believe you're looking for.

Hey Zachary :wave: the `layout.css` file is typically used for drag and drop in HubSpot but you could likely use it in other places if you wanted to. This is based on an old version of bootstrap and the way I read it is that there are the base styles for all breakpoints at the top and then there are some additional media queries to handle scenarios on smaller/larger screens but if there is no media query specified it falls back to the base styles at the top.

In general this is definitely something we are interested in updating so that the grid is more modern and simple in terms of the code used (open issue on updating this can be found here: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/issues/319>).
